title: Exodus Chapter 36 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 36 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 36 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 36.

questions.question: Who were the two main craftsmen mentioned as working on the sanctuary in Exodus 36?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:1 and 36:2 mention Bezaleel and Aholiab as the main craftsmen who worked on the sanctuary.

questions.question: What did the people bring to Moses for the work of the sanctuary according to Exodus 36:3?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:3 states that the children of Israel brought offerings and free offerings every morning for the work of the sanctuary.

questions.question: What did the wise men say to Moses about the materials brought by the people in Exodus 36?
options: The people bring much more than enough
The materials are of poor quality
questions.correctAnswer: The people bring much more than enough
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:5 records the wise men telling Moses that the people brought much more than enough for the service of the work.

questions.question: What instruction did Moses give after hearing that the people brought more than enough materials?
options: Stop making work for the offering
Send people to gather more materials
questions.correctAnswer: Stop making work for the offering
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:6 states that Moses commanded a proclamation so no man or woman would make more work for the offering, and the people were restrained from bringing more.

questions.question: How many curtains of fine twined linen did the wise men make for the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:8 specifies that ten curtains of fine twined linen were made by the wise men.

questions.question: What was the length of one curtain made of fine twined linen?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:9 states the length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits.

questions.question: How many taches of gold were made to join the linen curtains together?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:13 mentions fifty taches of gold were made to couple the curtains together.

questions.question: What material were the eleven curtains made for the tent covering?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:14 states that the eleven curtains for the tent covering were made of goats' hair.

questions.question: What was the length of one goats' hair curtain mentioned in Exodus 36?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:15 indicates one goats' hair curtain was thirty cubits long.

questions.question: What were the two types of skins used for coverings of the tent over the tabernacle?
options: Rams' skins dyed red and badgers' skins
questions.correctAnswer: Rams' skins dyed red and badgers' skins
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:19 records a covering of rams' skins dyed red and a covering of badgers' skins above that.

questions.question: True or False: The boards for the tabernacle were made of shittim wood and were ten cubits long.
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:20 and 36:21 state the boards were made of shittim wood with a length of ten cubits.

questions.question: How many boards were made for the south side of the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:23 specifies twenty boards were made for the south side of the tabernacle.

questions.question: How many sockets of silver were made to hold the twenty boards on the south side?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:24 states forty sockets of silver were made under the twenty boards, two sockets per board.

questions.question: True or False: The bars for the boards of the tabernacle were overlaid with gold.
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:34 explains that the bars were overlaid with gold as well as the boards and rings.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Exodus 36:35: 'And he made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined _________: with cherubims made he it of cunning work.'
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:35 says the vail was made of fine twined linen with cherubims of cunning work.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 36 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 36 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with knowing how to serve God effectively in their church. Based on Exodus 36, what biblical truth would you share about gaining wisdom for service?
options: God puts wisdom and understanding in the hearts of those He calls to serve
Only those trained by Moses can serve effectively
Service is only for those with natural talent
One must first gather many offerings before serving
questions.correctAnswer: God puts wisdom and understanding in the hearts of those He calls to serve
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:1 and 36:2 show that the LORD put wisdom and understanding in the hearts of Bezaleel, Aholiab, and all the wise-hearted men to know how to work for the sanctuary service. This teaches that God equips those He calls to serve with the necessary wisdom.

questions.question: How does Exodus 36 illustrate the principle of stewardship in the context of offerings for God's work?
options: The people brought more than enough offerings and were then told to stop giving
People were forced to give exactly what Moses commanded
Offerings were only accepted once a month
Moses kept all offerings for himself
questions.correctAnswer: The people brought more than enough offerings and were then told to stop giving
questions.explanation: Verses 3 to 7 explain how the people brought free offerings daily, more than enough for the work, and Moses commanded that no more offerings be brought because the materials were sufficient. This demonstrates faithful stewardship and obedience.

questions.question: A church leader notices some members are overly anxious about contributing to the church projects. Based on Exodus 36, what teaching on contentment and trust would you share?
options: God provides sufficiently for His work, and excessive offerings are not necessary
More offerings always mean more blessings
Members must give beyond their means to be faithful
Only leaders should decide what offerings to accept
questions.correctAnswer: God provides sufficiently for His work, and excessive offerings are not necessary
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:7 shows that the materials for the sanctuary work were sufficient and more than enough, and the people were restrained from bringing more. This encourages believers to trust God’s provision and be content.

questions.question: How does the description of the skilled workers in Exodus 36 teach about using God-given gifts in serving the church community?
options: Each wise-hearted person used their gift to contribute to the sanctuary’s construction
Only the priests were allowed to serve
Work was assigned randomly without regard to skill
The work was outsourced to foreign craftsmen
questions.correctAnswer: Each wise-hearted person used their gift to contribute to the sanctuary’s construction
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:1, 4, and 8 describe how every wise-hearted person who had wisdom from God contributed to making the sanctuary. This shows how God equips and calls believers to use their gifts in service.

questions.question: A new believer feels unsure about their role in church service. What does Exodus 36 teach about willingness and motivation in serving God?
options: Everyone whose heart stirred him up came willingly to do the work
Service should be done reluctantly to keep discipline
One must be paid to serve
questions.correctAnswer: Everyone whose heart stirred him up came willingly to do the work
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:2 states that every one whose heart stirred him up came unto the work to do it, emphasizing voluntary, motivated service as a biblical principle.

questions.question: How does Exodus 36 emphasize the importance of obedience in completing God’s work?
options: All work was done according to all that the LORD had commanded
The workers made changes as they saw fit
Only some parts of the instructions were followed
The work was delayed due to disobedience
questions.correctAnswer: All work was done according to all that the LORD had commanded
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:1 clarifies that the work was done for the sanctuary service according to all the LORD had commanded, highlighting obedience as essential in serving God.

questions.question: A believer is wondering about the value of detailed work in serving God. What can Exodus 36 teach about diligence and attention to detail in ministry?
options: The curtains were made with cherubims of cunning work and precise measurements
The work was done hastily without care
Only the large parts of the tabernacle mattered
questions.correctAnswer: The curtains were made with cherubims of cunning work and precise measurements
questions.explanation: Verses 8 to 13 describe the making of curtains with intricate cherubim designs and detailed measurements, showing that God values diligent and skillful work in ministry.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 36, Moses personally made all the boards and bars for the tabernacle.
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:20-34 explains that Bezaleel and the craftsmen made the boards, bars, and overlaid them with gold. Moses called the workers but did not personally make the parts.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 36 teaches that generosity should be controlled by wise leadership to prevent excess giving.
questions.explanation: In verses 5-7, Moses commands the camp to stop bringing offerings because they had enough, showing that leadership can guide generosity to prevent excess and promote order.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Exodus 36 describes the curtain of the tabernacle being made of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined ______, with cherubims of cunning work.
questions.explanation: Verse 35 and 8 describe the curtains as made of fine twined linen with blue, purple, and scarlet colors, highlighting the careful and holy workmanship.

questions.question: How does Exodus 36 demonstrate the value of teamwork and fellowship in accomplishing God’s work?
options: Many wise-hearted men worked together, each contributing to the sanctuary
Only one person did all the work alone
The work was done in isolation without communication
Workers competed against each other for recognition
questions.correctAnswer: Many wise-hearted men worked together, each contributing to the sanctuary
questions.explanation: Verses 1, 4, and 8 show that many wise-hearted men worked in harmony, each using their God-given wisdom and talents, teaching the importance of fellowship and teamwork.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged by the complexity of serving God. What does Exodus 36 teach about perseverance and faithfulness in detailed service?
options: The workers continued diligently in making every part until the tabernacle was complete
They gave up when the work was hard
They took shortcuts to finish faster
questions.correctAnswer: The workers continued diligently in making every part until the tabernacle was complete
questions.explanation: The detailed description of all the boards, curtains, loops, taches, and coverings in verses 8-38 shows faithful perseverance to complete God’s instructions fully.

questions.question: According to Exodus 36, what role does obedience to God’s instructions play in our work ethic as believers?
options: Obedience ensures the work is acceptable and glorifies God
Obedience is optional if the work looks good
Our personal ideas are more important than instructions
Work should be done only when convenient
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience ensures the work is acceptable and glorifies God
questions.explanation: Verse 1 states that the work was done according to all that the LORD commanded, highlighting that obedience is crucial for acceptable service and honoring God.

questions.question: A believer wonders how to balance generosity with wisdom in giving. What does Exodus 36 teach about this balance?
options: Generosity should be plentiful but also controlled by wise leadership
Giving should be unlimited with no boundaries
Giving is not necessary for service
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity should be plentiful but also controlled by wise leadership
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:3-7 shows that the people gave freely and generously, but Moses instructed them to stop when enough was given, showing balance between generosity and wise stewardship.

questions.question: How does Exodus 36 model humility and gratitude in serving God’s purposes?
options: The workers humbly used the gifts God gave and gratefully followed His instructions
The workers boasted about their skills
They sought personal glory over God’s glory
questions.correctAnswer: The workers humbly used the gifts God gave and gratefully followed His instructions
questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes that the wisdom and skill to work came from the LORD (verses 1-2), and the workers faithfully followed the commands, showing humility and gratitude.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 36 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 36.

questions.question: Who were the two chief artisans mentioned as leading the work on the sanctuary in Exodus 36?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:1 and 36:2 identify Bezaleel and Aholiab as the wise-hearted men whom the LORD endowed with wisdom to carry out the sanctuary's work.

questions.question: What was the reason Moses commanded the people to stop bringing offerings for the sanctuary?
options: They had collected more than enough materials
The priests instructed them to stop
questions.correctAnswer: They had collected more than enough materials
questions.explanation: According to Exodus 36:5-7, the people brought more than enough for the work, so Moses instructed them to stop bringing offerings.

questions.question: What colors were used in the ten curtains made for the tabernacle?
options: Blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen
questions.correctAnswer: Blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:8 describes the curtains as made of fine twined linen, and the colors blue, purple, and scarlet with cherubim designs.

questions.question: How many curtains of goats' hair were made for the tent over the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:14 specifies that eleven curtains of goats' hair were made for the tent covering the tabernacle.

questions.question: What materials were used for the outer coverings of the tabernacle tent?
options: Rams' skins dyed red and badgers' skins
questions.correctAnswer: Rams' skins dyed red and badgers' skins
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:19 states the coverings were made of rams' skins dyed red with badgers' skins on top.

questions.question: What type of wood was used to make the boards for the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:20 identifies the boards as made of shittim wood, also known as acacia wood in other translations.

questions.question: How many silver sockets were made for the twenty boards on the south side of the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:24 explains that forty silver sockets were made for the twenty boards, two sockets per board.

questions.question: What was the significance of the gold overlay on the boards and bars of the tabernacle?
options: It symbolized holiness and God's glory
It was for durability and strength
It represented the wealth of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolized holiness and God's glory
questions.explanation: Gold in biblical tabernacle construction represents holiness and divine presence, as seen in the overlay of boards and bars in Exodus 36:34.

questions.question: The veil made for the tabernacle was embroidered with what figures?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:35 states the veil was made with cherubim embroidered by skilled work.

questions.question: The coupling of the curtains involved making what kind of connectors?
questions.explanation: Verses 36:11-13 describe how fifty loops and fifty taches of gold were used to couple curtains into one tabernacle.

questions.question: True or False: The five pillars of the hanging at the tabernacle door had sockets made of silver.
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:38 states that the five sockets for the pillars at the door were made of brass, not silver.

questions.question: How does the detailed craftsmanship in Exodus 36 reflect the ancient Near Eastern cultural context?
options: It aligns with the high value placed on temple construction and ritual purity
It reflects a lack of skilled artisans at the time
It shows an emphasis on military fortification
It indicates a secular purpose for the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: It aligns with the high value placed on temple construction and ritual purity
questions.explanation: The precision and materials used in Exodus 36 mirror ancient Near Eastern temple traditions valuing sacred space and purity.

questions.question: What literary device is demonstrated by the repeated use of 'wise hearted men' in Exodus 36?
questions.explanation: The phrase 'wise hearted men' is repeated in verses 1, 2, and 8 to emphasize the gifted artisans chosen by God.

questions.question: Which New Testament passage most directly echoes the typology of the tabernacle's gold overlay symbolizing holiness?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 9 references the tabernacle and its holy objects, highlighting their significance as foreshadowing Christ's ministry.

questions.question: According to Exodus 36, how many bars made of shittim wood were made for the boards on the tabernacle's sides?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:31-32 specifies five bars on each of the three sides, totaling fifteen bars made of shittim wood.

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 36 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 36 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who were the primary craftsmen empowered by God to work on the sanctuary in Exodus 36?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:1 and 36:2 explicitly name Bezaleel and Aholiab as the men filled with wisdom by the LORD to craft the sanctuary. This divine empowerment echoes Exodus 31:1-6 and parallels the spiritual gifting seen in the New Testament such as in 1 Corinthians 12:4-7, where God distributes gifts for the common good.

questions.question: According to Exodus 36, what motivated the people to bring offerings for the sanctuary work?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:2 describes how every man whose heart was stirred brought offerings willingly. This voluntary giving reflects the biblical principle of cheerful giving found in 2 Corinthians 9:7 and the Old Testament principle seen in Deuteronomy 16:10.

questions.question: What action did Moses take when the offerings for the sanctuary exceeded what was needed?
options: He commanded the people to stop bringing more
questions.correctAnswer: He commanded the people to stop bringing more
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:6 records Moses' command to proclaim that no more offerings were to be brought, as the materials were already sufficient. This shows the order and provision of God, consistent with principles in 1 Chronicles 29:14 and Proverbs 3:9 about honoring God with what is sufficient.

questions.question: What materials were used to make the ten curtains of the tabernacle's inner covering?
options: Fine twined linen with blue, purple, and scarlet
questions.correctAnswer: Fine twined linen with blue, purple, and scarlet
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:8 specifies the ten curtains were made of fine twined linen dyed blue, purple, and scarlet with cherubim embroidered. These colors symbolize royalty and holiness, consistent with the use of these colors in priestly garments (Exodus 28:5-6) and signify God's majestic presence (Revelation 19:8).

questions.question: How many curtains of goats’ hair were made for the tabernacle's outer tent covering?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:14 and 36:15 describe the making of eleven curtains of goats' hair for the tent covering. This layering of coverings foreshadows the layered nature of Christ’s atonement (Hebrews 10:19-22) and God's provision of protection for His people.

questions.question: What materials were used for the sockets supporting the boards of the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:24 and 36:26 state that forty silver sockets were made for the twenty boards on each side. Silver, a precious metal, symbolizes redemption (Psalm 49:7) and value, reinforcing the sacredness of the tabernacle structure.

questions.question: What was the length and breadth of one board used in the tabernacle's construction?
options: Ten cubits long and one and a half cubits broad
Five cubits long and two cubits broad
Twelve cubits long and one cubit broad
Seven cubits long and two cubits broad
questions.correctAnswer: Ten cubits long and one and a half cubits broad
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:21 states each board was ten cubits long and one and a half cubits wide. The precise dimensions reflect God’s order and design in worship spaces, paralleling Solomon’s temple construction (1 Kings 6:15) and the New Jerusalem description (Revelation 21:16).

questions.question: What was the purpose of the fifty loops and fifty taches mentioned in Exodus 36?
options: To couple curtains together forming one tabernacle
To decorate the tabernacle with gold and brass
To hang the vail and door hanging
To secure the boards to the sockets
questions.correctAnswer: To couple curtains together forming one tabernacle
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:11-13 describe the loops and taches being used to join the curtains into one unified tabernacle covering. This unity symbolizes the oneness of God's people (Ephesians 4:4-6) and the holistic nature of the sanctuary as God's dwelling place.

questions.question: What materials were used to overlay the boards and bars of the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:34 states the boards and bars were overlaid with gold. Gold symbolizes divinity, purity, and eternal value (Revelation 21:18-21), reflecting the holiness and glory of God dwelling among His people.

questions.question: What was the composition of the veil made for the tabernacle as described in Exodus 36?
options: Blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims
questions.correctAnswer: Blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen with cherubims
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:35 describes the veil made with blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen embroidered with cherubims. The veil symbolized the separation between God’s holiness and human sinfulness (Hebrews 10:19-20) and the cherubims signified divine presence (Genesis 3:24).

questions.question: How many pillars were made for the veil, and what were they overlaid with?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:36 records four pillars of shittim wood overlaid with gold for the veil. The gold overlay emphasizes the sanctity and glory of the barrier between the Holy Place and the Most Holy Place (Exodus 26:31-33), highlighting God's holiness.

questions.question: What was the covering material dyed red placed over the tent of the tabernacle?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:19 describes a covering of rams’ skins dyed red over the tent. The red dye can symbolize the blood of sacrifice and atonement, pointing forward to Christ’s redeeming blood (Hebrews 9:12-14).

questions.question: What was the final outermost covering of the tabernacle tent made from?
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:19 states the outermost covering was badgers’ skins placed above the rams’ skins dyed red. This protective covering symbolizes God’s providential care and the imperfection of earthly things compared to heavenly realities (Hebrews 9:11).

questions.question: How many pillars and sockets were made for the hanging at the tabernacle door, and what metals were used?
options: Five pillars with brass sockets and gold overlays
Four pillars with silver sockets and bronze overlays
Six pillars with gold sockets and silver overlays
Three pillars with brass sockets and silver overlays
questions.correctAnswer: Five pillars with brass sockets and gold overlays
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:37-38 describes five pillars with brass sockets and gold overlays for the door hanging. The mix of metals symbolizes the combination of judgment and holiness, as brass often represents judgment (Exodus 27:1-2) and gold represents divine glory.

questions.question: What theological truth is demonstrated by the detailed and precise craftsmanship commanded by God in this chapter?
options: God's holiness demands order, beauty, and reverence in worship
The sanctuary was an optional suggestion
God approves only simple and unadorned worship
questions.correctAnswer: God's holiness demands order, beauty, and reverence in worship
questions.explanation: The extensive details in Exodus 36 about materials, dimensions, and skilled work reflect God's demand for holiness and reverence (Leviticus 10:1-3), consistent with the principle that God is a God of order (1 Corinthians 14:40) and worthy of the best from His people (Malachi 1:6-8).

questions.question: What does the Spirit’s empowerment of Bezaleel and Aholiab for artistic work imply about the role of the Holy Spirit in the life of believers?
options: The Holy Spirit equips for diverse service and glorifying God
The Holy Spirit only empowers prophets and preachers
Human skill is sufficient without divine help
Artistic work is secular and irrelevant to faith
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Spirit equips for diverse service and glorifying God
questions.explanation: Exodus 36:1-2 shows God putting wisdom and skill into craftsmen, illustrating that the Holy Spirit equips believers for a variety of service roles (1 Corinthians 12:7-11). This affirms that all gifts, including artistic ones, are given to build up the body and glorify God (Ephesians 2:10).
